archetype_name: Family Turkish & North African Suppers (Medium, 30–60, Intermediate)
name: Izmir-Style Beef Köfte Tray Bake with Bulgur Pilaf and Preserved Lemon Chopped Salad
description: Baked Turkish beef köfte with potatoes, peppers, and tomato-chili sauce, served with fluffy bulgur pilaf and a bright preserved-lemon salad. Medium warmth and family-friendly, cooked on the stovetop and in the oven.
prep_steps: Finely chop 1 of the onions and 3 cloves of garlic for the köfte mix.
Slice the remaining onion into thin half-moons for the sauce.
Cut potatoes into 1 cm thick wedges; cut bell peppers into strips.
Chop parsley; finely chop 1 slice of preserved lemon (rind only) for the salad.
Dice tomatoes and cucumber for the salad; thinly slice red onion.
Rinse bulgur in a sieve; drain.
cook_steps: Make köfte: In a bowl, mix beef mince, the finely chopped onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, parsley (2 tbsp), ground cumin (1 tsp), paprika (1 tsp), chili flakes (1/2 tsp), salt, and black pepper. Form 12–16 oval patties.
Start tray base: In a large ovenproof dish, toss potatoes and bell peppers with olive oil (2 tbsp), salt, and black pepper.
Sear köfte: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Sear köfte 1–2 min per side to brown (do not cook through). Transfer onto the potatoes and peppers.

Make sauce: In the same skillet, add sliced onion with a little olive oil if needed; cook 3–4 min. Add 1 clove minced garlic, tomato paste (1 tbsp), chili flakes (1/4 tsp), ground cumin (1/2 tsp); cook 1 min. Stir in crushed tomatoes (1 cup) and water (1/2 cup); season with salt and black pepper. Simmer 2–3 min.
Bake: Pour the sauce over the tray. Cover loosely with foil and bake 20 min, then uncover and bake 10–15 min until potatoes are tender and köfte are cooked through.

Cook bulgur pilaf: While the tray bakes, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a saucepan over medium. Add 2 tbsp finely chopped onions; cook 2–3 min. Stir in rinsed bulgur (1 cup) to coat 1 min. Add hot vegetable stock (1.75 cups), a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low 12–15 min until liquid is absorbed. Rest 5 min, fluff with a fork.

Make salad: In a bowl, combine diced tomatoes, cucumber, sliced red onion, chopped parsley (2 tbsp), finely chopped preserved lemon, olive oil (1–2 tbsp), lemon juice (1 tbsp), sumac (1/2 tsp), salt, and black pepper. Toss and set aside.
Serve: Spoon bulgur pilaf onto plates, add köfte, peppers, and potatoes with pan sauce. Serve salad on the side.
